greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: For p = prime(n), a(n) = number of bases 1 < b < p such that b^(p-1) == 1 (mod p^2).
comment: a(n) > 0 if and only if p is in A134307.
link: Robert Israel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
program: (PARI) i=0; forprime(p=2, 10^3, a=2; while(a<p, if(Mod(a, p^2)^(p-1)==1, i++); a++); print1(i, ", "); i=0)
results.author: _Felix Fröhlich_, Jul 12 2014
